"Alright," I say. "Let's go to the Overseer first, then. Can you teleport us there now?"
"I'm on it!" Flower says, as we are both getting enveloped by a bright white light.

"Here we are!" Flower says.

When I look around, I see that we're now somewhere in the sea of light called the ether, with the Overseer's green-eyed drone floating right next to us.

"Processing. Processing..." the Overseer says. "The Overseer protocol now understands why it couldn't find your group anywhere in the ether. Having witnessed your ability to teleport, my assumption is that you all must have teleported to a safe haven where you are undetectable. Is that correct?"

"Um, yeah," Flower says. "That's right... Wait, you've been looking for us?"
"Affirmative," the Overseer says. "The Overseer protocol wishes to apologize for the inconvenience it has caused. Your souls were not meant to be teleported outside of your minds along with the rebels' souls. Unfortunately, the technique I used was still experimental, and it ended up affecting the whole area of the battlefield instead of targeting only our common enemies."

"Oh, it's no problem!" Flower says. "Everyone's fine now. So anyway, we wanted to ask you if you'd like to fight Peter and the king of the underground together with us here, on the ethereal plane. I could teleport us to them right now if you want!"

"The Overseer protocol accepts your offer," the green-eyed drone says. "That was the destination that I was heading to as well."

"Great!" Flower says. "Get ready, then. We're teleporting in three... two... one..."

"Good!" the king of the underground says. "So I'm not just imagining things, then!"

He then stretches his arm forward, while pointing his palm towards us, and an invisible force suddenly pushes me and Flower back about ten feet.

B3-Ch09b-Melding.text:
"Barry, wake up!" she shouts, desperately. "You're fading away! Please, wake up!"
As I finally manage to pull myself together and open my eyes, I realize that she was right. I really am fading away. My body has become almost completely transparent and I am being overwhelmed by a sensation of fatigue and nausea that is hard to describe, while my consciousness is drifting between the earthen and ethereal plane constantly.

"Barry, listen to me!" Flower says, when she sees that I've opened my eyes. "Do you remember what the inside of your mind looked like on the ethereal plane? Can you visualize it?"

I try to listen to her words, but they are not making any sense in my head. Everything feels like it's so far away... as if I were only a spectator watching the end of my life unfold before my eyes, without grasping the direct impact that it has on me, as a person. I am just so tired. The only thing I want to do now is go back to sleep.

"Barry, I need to know that you understand me!" Flower says in a panicky voice. "I need you to tell me that-- oh my gods, you're almost gone. Barry, stay with me, please! Barry!!!"
Flower's screams are nothing more than background noise to me now. As soon as my body from the ethereal plane becomes completely transparent, the fatigue disappears, and it is replaced with a feeling of calm, as I quickly begin to lose any sense of who I am or what I had been doing until a few moments prior, and I can feel myself melding with the light around me, while my consciousness is slowly fading away.

At long last, it is over. At long last, I can rest.

B3-Ch09b-Manually.text:
As I continue to narrowly avoid the multitude of homing projectiles, I happen to catch a glimpse of Peter, who seems to be deeply focused on the fireballs that are following me, and is even directing some of them with his hands from afar.
What's going on, here?... Why does it look like he's controlling some of those fireballs manually? The whole point of this spell is that the fireballs are supposed to follow their target on their own, so that you can continue to cast other spells while your enemy is distracted. Normally, Peter should have no business directing any of the projectiles.

But what if...

What if this isn't his previous spell at all?... What if he just used his ethereal powers to create a bunch of fireballs out of nothing, in the same way that Flower made that palm tree and turned it into a cart?

Of course... If I think about it like this, then it all makes sense!

My dispelling did work! He's just trying to fool me into thinking that it didn't, so that I won't try to interrupt him and make him lose his focus on all these dozens of fireballs that he is controlling individually.

This is it. This is the answer that I was looking for. Now I know exactly what I need to do!

After I dodge a few more of the flaming projectiles, I lure them away from Peter on purpose, and once my path towards him is clear, I make a beeline for my opponent, while preparing a very simple daze spell that can barely make someone dizzy for a few seconds.
Once I get close enough, I cast the spell on him and the very next moment, all of the fireballs disappear, while Peter is quickly recovering from his short stupor.

"Hah!" I say. "I knew it! I knew that my dispelling couldn't have failed! I should have known that this would be a trick from the very beginning."

"You are testing my patience..." Peter says. "You don't want me to use my actual powerful spells against you in this realm. Give up now, if you don't want to risk your life needlessly."

"I'm sorry, was that supposed to intimidate me?" I say. "Because that didn't sound scary at all. Maybe you should try investing a few more points in your Bluff stat."

Instead of answering me, Peter begins to cast an even more complicated spell that if I'm not mistaken is meant to fill a huge area with endless raindrops of a freezing liquid that is cold enough to incapacitate you in a matter of seconds. I have to do something about this quick.

While I am still trembling from the cold, I point towards Peter with my right hand and then I spin my index-finger counter-clockwise, while I imagine some invisible earplugs dropping from his ears.

B3-Ch09b-Poison.text:
For a short while, I was hoping that the anti-poison elixir which I drank on the earthen plane might actually work here, but I guess I was being too optimistic. The effects of the poison hit me almost instantly, as I'm now getting a strong headache and I begin to cough up blood. The headache is nowhere near as bad as the one that I got from the botched teleportation when I was transported to the underground caverns with Leila, but that's not really saying much. This is still much worse than any hangover I've ever had, and it's greatly affecting my concentration.
Of all the things that could have gotten the best of me, it just had to be poison... It's a good thing that Illuna isn't here, or I'd never hear the end of it.

I waste no time and I blow the poison cloud away with a gust of wind. The harm has already been done, but at least now it won't get any worse than it already is. Now where is Peter hiding?... I assumed that he would try to use the mist as cover to take me by surprise, but he is nowhere in sight. Don't tell me that he used the poison cloud just to run away?...

"I only tried this spell on a whim, but I never imagined that it would actually work," I hear Peter's voice, who has apparently turned himself invisible while I wasn't watching. "What kind of an idiot goes into a mage battle without having cast any sort of protection against poison attacks? Maybe I've overestimated you after all..."
"What's with the invisibility spell?" I tell Peter, as I cough up some more blood. "Do you think you're Albert or something? You do realize that you're nowhere near as good as him at hiding your aura, don't you? I can easily tell where you are and I don't even have my stat device here to boost my magical sense."

"You might be good at memorizing spells, but you don't seem to be very well versed in poisons," Peter says. "Let me give you a hint. Time is not on your side right now. The more you wait, the more the effects of the poison will sink in, and you will lose all of your senses one by one. Your ability to detect auras will likely be the first one you'll lose, followed by your sense of smell and then your sight. I am only giving you this warning because of what little respect I still have left for you as a fellow generalist. If you still have any secret techniques that you were saving up until the last moment, then I recommend that you use them all now. Do not disappoint me any further."

B3-Ch09b-Appreciate.text:
"You know, I really appreciate all the help you're giving me, Peter," I say, as I struggle to appear unaffected by the headache. "You were even kind enough to remind me that I still have a secret technique which I haven't used until now. I might have completely forgotten about it if you hadn't mentioned it, so thank you for that!"
"If you still think you can defeat me, then you'd better do it now," Peter says. "Soon, you won't even be able to tell where I am anymore."

"Actually, I think I might have a better idea!" I say. "Why don't I hold on to this secret technique for a while longer, to keep you on the edge? This strategy seems to have been working wonders so far!"

Peter does not answer me and I can't see the reaction on his face since he's still invisible, but if I were to guess, I'd say that he's probably pretty pissed right now. The fact that he specifically brought up the idea of me revealing my secret techniques made his previous 'advice' seem very suspicious to me. He's clearly trying to bait me, here. If this poison were really meant to get worse over time, he would have tried to stall me instead of telling me to attack him. There really was no reason for him to tell me about all of this unless...

Unless his poison is only temporary and he never bothered to learn any poison spells with long lasting effects! Yes, that has to be it! Now that I'm paying some more attention to my headache and nausea, it does kind of feel like it's getting better, even though the improvement is subtle. Let's see if I can buy a little more time by taking advantage of his unfounded cautiousness around me.

"By the gods, you were telling the truth!" I say, as I am now feigning some fear in my voice. "The poison really is getting worse! What have you done to me, you bastard?!"
"...I warned you that this would happen," Peter says, in a slightly hesitant voice. "Did you think I was bluffing? Now hurry up and use your spells, before--"

"What did you do to your aura?!" I shout all of a sudden. "Reveal yourself, you coward! I thought you wanted to have a fair fight!"

"What are you talking about, you lunatic?" Peter says. "The poison couldn't have possibly affected you this badly in such a short amount of time. In fact, by now, you should already be--"

He pauses for a few seconds, as he slowly realizes what I've been doing.

"You figured it out, didn't you?" he asks me. "You were just buying time so that the effects of the poison would wear off..."

"Indeed," I say, as my headache and nausea have almost completely disappeared. "And now that I'm feeling well again, we can continue to duel fair and square, like the two fellow generalists that we are! Don't you agree?"

B3-Ch09b-Puddle.text:
Shortly after I finish my sentence, I begin to feel one of the most eerie and hard to describe sensations that I've ever experienced in my life. The feeling that I'm getting is as if my consciousness is being repeatedly thrust through a tunnel, back and forth, and it can't seem to decide at which end of the tunnel its destination is.
As this is happening, I'm finding myself for one second lying face-first in a puddle on a street, during a storm, and for the next second I'm back here on the ethereal plane, floating in the middle of the sea of light.

After being thrown around between the earthen and ethereal plane a few more times, I can sense all of the light around me connecting directly to my mind, and then I begin to hear some very clear thoughts in my head, as if they were my own, even though I am positive that I'm not the one thinking them.

"This is not the place to resolve your conflict," the voice in my head says. "Return to your sanctuaries now, and disturb these resting grounds no longer."
"Peter, did you hear that too?" the king of the underground says, as we're all temporarily frozen in place, unsure of what to do. "Who contacted us just now? Was it the ether?"

"I'm... not sure..." Peter says, as he is looking towards the king, with a somewhat fearful look in his eyes.

B3-Ch09b-Elephant.text:
A white light that is different from the one that makes up the ether envelops me and Flower, and then we both get teleported to a different location that looks exactly the same as the previous one. As I look around the endless sea of light to see if I can spot any large cubes, I suddenly feel the force that was pulling me back towards my sanctuary getting magnified a hundredfold.
"Okay, we're definitely closer, but I'm still not seeing the cube," I tell Flower. "I can feel myself being pulled in the same direction as before, but now it's as if an elephant is the one trying to drag me away, not a small dog."

"An elephant..." Flower says. "That means your sanctuary should be relatively close. Let's keep flying in that direction until we--"

As Flower is talking, her voice is getting gradually drowned out by the millions of voices that are now flooding my mind, along with rapidly changing images that are flashing in front of my eyes at too high of a speed for me to be able to tell what they are about.

The voices are all overlapping, but they're mostly just using different words to say the same thing:

'Leave this place!'
'Get out!'

'You do not belong here.'

I try to cover my ears, but it doesn't have any effect. The voices are all coming from inside my head, and they're only getting louder. After fifteen more seconds of this, the images stop flashing and my consciousness begins to drift in and out between the ethereal and earthen plane again. As I am still struggling to regain my composure, the voices all stop at the same time. All except for one: the voice that I'd heard while we were still fighting Peter and the king of the underground.

'You had been warned,' the voice tells me simply, and then my consciousness flips back and forth between both planes of existence for a thousand times in a single second, while it feels like my soul is being ripped by force from my body.

It's getting cold. So very cold. My thoughts are all a jumble. An extreme fatigue is now taking over me as it feels like the very essence of my being is slowly fading away, along with my imagined body from the ethereal plane, which is becoming more transparent with each passing moment.

"--arry!" I hear Flower's voice as if it were some distant memory. "Barry, look into my eyes! Look at me! Barry!!!"

B3-Ch09b-Visualize.text:
With what seems to be the last remaining ounce of my willpower, I manage to focus my gaze upon Flower, who is currently holding me by the shoulders while her flaming red eyes are shining brighter than ever before. Getting a better look at her, I see that not only her eyes are aflame, but her entire body is now made up entirely of fire... Or rather, the kind of fire that feels hot but for some reason is not burning me, even though she is touching me directly with it.
"Barry, I need you to think of what it was like inside the cube," Flower says, loudly. "I need you to visualize it clearly inside your head. Do you understand?"

"Yes..." I say, with my voice barely louder than a whisper.

Just like she asked, I try to remember every small detail that I can from the place called my 'sanctuary', and then I recreate it inside my head. I then close my eyes, so that I can see the image in my mind more clearly.

"I'm imagining it now..." I tell Flower, in the same weak voice as before.

"Do you have a clear image of it?" Flower says, in a panicky voice. "Are you certain?"
"Yes, yes," I tell her with my eyes still closed. "I'm looking at it as I'm speaking to you. What do I do now?"

I can no longer see my body from the ethereal plane because my eyes are closed, but I can tell that it's only gotten more transparent since I've started talking to Flower. I wonder how many more seconds I have left to live?...

"--arry!" Flower says, as I'm beginning to drift in and out of consciousness, catching only bits and pieces of what she is saying to me. "Listen-- me carefully-- no time-- no matter what-- open your eyes! Do-- hear me?! Barry-- losing you! Barry!!!"

It is hard to tell with my eyes still closed, but I think I'm being enveloped by the white light from Flower's teleporting spell again. Is she trying to send me back to my sanctuary? Is that why she asked me to imagine it inside my head?
As I continue to visualize the empty cube in my mind's eye, the bright light from both the teleportation spell and the ether disappears, and the only thing I can see through my eyelids is complete darkness. Does this mean that the teleportation was successful? I can't tell whether my body is back to normal or not. Aside from the light disappearing, I still feel weak, and it doesn't seem like much has changed.

The silence around me is deafening. The anticipation is killing me. Did I get teleported properly or not? I have to know!

B3-Ch09b-Open.text:
I open my eyes, but to my surprise it is not only the light that is gone from around me, but also everything else. The only thing that I'm seeing before my eyes is pure darkness.
"Flower, are you there?" I try to say, but my words do not leave my mouth.

After trying to talk a few more times, the weakness and fatigue slowly take over me and soon I don't even have the strength to open my mouth anymore. Several seconds later, I find myself closing my eyes again, but this time I lose my consciousness for good.

B3-Ch09b-Positive.text:
Just as I'm about to open my eyes, I remember Flower's warning from before she teleported me.
"--no matter what-- open your eyes!" were the words I heard her saying.

The phrase is not complete, but based on the structure of the sentence it feels like she was saying something along the lines of "no matter what, don't open your eyes".

I can't be sure of this, but she did tell me that I should keep visualizing the cube, and she never told me when to stop. I still have the image of the cube in front of me right now, so I guess I should probably keep thinking of it. This is the only thing I should be worrying about. Nothing else matters. Just keep imagining the cube.

A whole minute passes without me doing anything other than concentrating on the image of the sanctuary which I have in my head. Or at least I think it's been a minute. It's kind of hard to keep track of time in this complete darkness.

It's fine. There's no need to open my eyes. I'm still conscious for now, and this is all that matters. A minute ago, I could have sworn that I only had a few seconds left to live, but somehow I'm still here. I'm still awake. Whatever Flower did, it must have had at least some positive effect, or else I wouldn't be alive.

As I'm still waiting for something to happen, I suddenly feel myself being drenched from head to toe in freezing cold water, and when I instinctively jump up, I quickly realize that there is now ground beneath my feet, and it no longer feels like I'm floating in an endless darkness like before. The rain is pouring down my cheeks, a sound of lightning echoes in the distance, and the wind is still blowing, although not as hard as it did at the beginning of the storm.
Is this it?... Am I finally back on the earthen plane for good?

"Are you planning to open your eyes anytime soon, or are you expecting me to talk to you like this?..." I hear Flower's voice, speaking in Illuna's tone.

When I finally open my eyelids, I see that Flower is standing before me with flaming eyes in this plane of existence as well, except that the flames are blue, because Illuna is the one who is talking. Her body is not made up of flames like in the ethereal plane, however.

Every connection that I had with the ethereal plane is now gone. Even though I'm trying to switch my consciousness to the other realm, it's not working anymore. Could this be the result of my soul finally returning to my sanctuary on the ethereal plane?

"There was this... darkness," I tell Illuna. "It felt similar to the void that the Magium made me float around in when it almost erased me from the world, except this time I still had my memories and my identity left intact. I didn't really get to see it because I had my eyes closed the whole time, but the darkness around me seemed almost... oppressive. Like it was trying to swallow me whole. Do you have any idea what might have happened?"
"Ah, so that's what Flower did," Illuna says. "I had some pretty strong suspicions, but I could barely get any kind of coherent information out of her through our telepathic link when I talked to her earlier. I should probably let her know that she didn't end up killing you by accident before she gives herself a heart attack out of pure anxiety."

"She thought she might have killed me?..." I ask, in an uneasy tone. "Wait, what did she do?"

Instead of answering me, Illuna raises two fingers in the air in front of me, signaling me to be quiet while she talks to Flower telepathically in the ethereal plane. Once she is done, she lowers her hand so that we can resume our conversation.

B3-Ch09b-Fluke.text:
Just as I am about to head towards the castle myself, I get a sudden dizziness, and for a split second it feels like my consciousness is drifting away again into the ethereal plane, where I get a direct view of the inside of my empty cube that is supposed to be my sanctuary. What just happened? Did I really switch back to my perspective from the ethereal plane for a second there, or am I just imagining things?
"You alright, Barry?" Hadrik says, when he sees me frozen in place at the back of the group, and sweating something fierce.

"You didn't... feel anything just now?" I ask Hadrik, as I'm trying to calm myself down.

"What do you mean?" Hadrik asks. "What was I supposed to feel?"

"...Nothing," I tell him. "I'm sure it was nothing. Let's get going. We need to catch up to the others."

As Hadrik nods and then goes on ahead of me, I stand there in place for a few more seconds, contemplating on what just happened.

A fluke. It has to have been a fluke. Hadrik didn't experience anything unusual, so we're not being targeted by the Overseer again. Even if what I saw was real, I was clearly sitting inside my sanctuary, so there shouldn't be anything to worry about. I'm not going to get kicked out into the ether again.
After the brief pause, I decide that there's no point in dwelling on this any further, and I quicken my pace so that I can rejoin the rest of the group. For the next hour or so, as we journey towards the palace, the sensation of switching my focus towards the ethereal plane does not return to me, so I don't bring it up to any of my friends. Everything is fine. There is nothing to worry about. If it didn't happen again after so much time, then I'm sure it was nothing serious and the event will never repeat itself.

Everything is fine.
